intro: Thymus hirtus var. tenuifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features small, fragrant leaves that are typically gray-green in color and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its aromatic properties make it a popular choice for culinary and medicinal uses.
